column5: Congartulations old son. May you have many years of mischief and fishing trips together. Time to dust off that rocking chair and have the Mrs warm up some milk and cookies for you
That's gotta be great news, John.  I always thought that newborns looked like a tomato casserole, but I guess that's just me.  Congratulations to your entire extended fambly.
wow John that is super congrats,thats the only thing missing in my and my wifes life!  All you guys with grand kiddies are lucky guys!
Congrats John.
Congratz John hears to a long happy healthy life fishing with his grandpa
Congratulations Grandpa
Congrats!
Hi John; Please let me add my congratulations to all of the above. Garry2R's

Ive been a Grandparent for three years now...now you need to decide what the babe is going to call you ...i think your going to be surprised at how many different ways there is to refer to a grandfather/grandmother...personally...we went with Nanny and Poppa....reason being is ...Poppa is alot easier to say for a babe then Daddy..  CONGRATULATIONS John!!!!!...your gunna love it !  Cheers!
Fantastic!!!

Congratulations.  If your kids have been out of the house for awhile and you have got used to being #1 in your wife's eyes...well I'm sorry to be the one to tell you that this is about to change.  You are now officially #2. And not a close #2 either....  A very very distant #2.  But it has it's perks. My grandson who's 3 in July is out with "Gemma" shoveling the driveway right now...while I'm sitting here in my PJ's with my coffee

Matt's (the proud father) generation in our family have been pretty inventive about coining grandparent handles. Wendy's folks were renamed Granny (yeah, I know, boring) and Bumpa (that's inventive) but the prize goes to Matt and his brother for naming my Mom Gabby. That's what they got out of Gramma and boy, did it catch on. She's now only known as Gabby by half the population of our town. Even her old friends call her Gabby. She loves it.  Wendy and I are just going to wait to see what the little guy comes up with for us. Anything will be good.  Here's a pic of the little prince.    I'll get him a better hat for fishing, and some polarized shades. I've already got a couple of rod setups ready. One's a short ultralite spinning rig and the other is a 4'6" rod with a Pfleuger Underspin trigger reel, like a hybrid baitcaster/spinning reel. I don't think he'll be ready for real baitcasting for a few years. He may actually be happier with a Spiderman rig (or whoever the superhero of the day is when he's ready) but these others will be ready for him.  JF

Same with my daughter Erika. My mother-in-law used to always say  Erika was her sweet little Chickie. So Erika started calling her Chickie right back and it stuck. All Xmas and birthday cards and gifts  from then on where signed from Chickie.  Debbe's mom loved it too..and everyone who knew her well just started calling her that too.
Great news John, congratulations &  and best wishes to the entire family, but specially for the little guy !!
Welcome to the club John. I have 3 and on other coming in June. They are great if you don't mind having things broken.
Congratulations and blessings to you and yours John. BTW, being #2 has some awesome benefits. Abuse Use them to your full advantage.  Regards, Simon
Congrats John! what a great start to Grandfatherhood
That's way cool John, put a smile on me face indeed. Congratulations to all the family.

What a great gift. Our first grandchild, a healthy beautiful boy, arrived yesterday at 3 pm. Everybody's doing great.  Dunno who he looks like. Don't think there's anyone in the family with a face like a big red whithered apple and no teeth. I was holding him last night and he made an awful variety of faces at me like he was trying to poop on me but I didn't mind.  He's not very smart yet. He kept trying to get his hand to his mouth but he was all wrapped up like a "burrito" as my son described the wrapping job when the nurse showed him how. I snuck one of his little hands out in the open but he just kept trying to munch on the burritoed one. Holding him is like holding a little furnace. He'd be a handy little guy in an ice hut.  I have a pic of me holding him here somewhere. Maybe I'll post it later.  JF
Congratulations John. A very special moment for sure.  Glad to hear everyone is doing well.
Some of my best moments as a father are watching my son with his grandparents.
Congrats John! I got number 4 Friday, another one without a crank.   Not that it matters much to me.
Ditto.  Those are my favourite moments.
Great news John   Congrats

Talk about great reports.... Felicitations! I have eleven of the little treasures....soon to be Great Grandfather...well, maybe not so great but it's still very nice. I can see some online purchased miniature scuba gear arriving soon.  Congrats to your family, John!
Congrads John,  I can think of one wrinkely red face in your family, but I'm not sayin...
Fantastic news John, best wishes to the mum too!
Wonderful news big guy !!! You must be just BEAMING right about now. He will make you feel young all over again.
congrats john!
Congratulations John!! He is a lucky boy, having a cool granddad. Best wishes to the entire family. Jim
Congrads to you and your family !! Now you got yourself a new fishing partner
Hey GRAMPA,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  CONGRATS TO THE FAMILY.
Congrats John.... that'll little bundle will do wonders for your spirit!!!
And the BEST part of grandchildren is they go home after vistiting....
CONGRATS!  WELCOME to some of the best years of your life
congratulations to your family John.  And just remember, that little burrito is NOT a new musky bait!  PS... I am ahead of you by two already
Congratulations John.........we have 5 of the little beggers, spoiling them and then giving them back to Mom and Dad NEVER gets old!
Congrats!

I was afraid my wife was going to try to steal him at the hospital last night. She's floating on air right now. I don't think sending him home will be the problem for a while. It will be more about her letting him go home.  JF
Well congratulations Grandpa! Just remember you load them up with chocolate JUST before you send them home to mom and dad LOL.
Great news John! Congratulations to you and your family.
Congrat's to you and everyone else in your family John. That's big news!
